alert.note: Alert for Yavapai (Arizona) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued August 07 at 5:57PM MST until August 08 at 12:00AM MST by NWS Flagstaff
info.description: The National Weather Service in Flagstaff has issued a * Flash Flood Warning for... Yavapai County in west central Arizona... * Until midnight MST Monday. * At 556 PM MST, Doppler radar indicated thunderstorms producing heavy rain across the warned area. Between 1 and 1.75 inches of rain have fallen. Flash flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly. HAZARD...Life-threatening flash flooding. Thunderstorms producing flash flooding. SOURCE...Radar. IMPACT...Life-threatening flash flooding of low-water crossings, creeks, normally dry washes and roads. * Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Cordes Lakes, Cordes Junction, Cordes, Spring Valley, Bumble Bee, Black Canyon City and Rock Springs. This includes the following highways... State Route 69 between mile markers 263 and 269. Interstate 17 between mile markers 242 and 274. This includes the following creeks, washes and rivers... Hackberry Creek, Black Canyon Creek, Indian Creek, Squaw Creek, Slate Creek, Big Bug Creek, Dry Creek, Ash Creek, Little Ash Creek, North Fork Rock Creek, Black Canyon, Hackberry Wash, Rock Creek, Antelope Creek, Silver Creek, Agua Fria River, Cienega Creek, Cedar Creek, Bishop Creek, Yarber Wash, Crazy Basin Creek, Castle Creek, Badger Spring Wash, Turkey Creek, Sycamore Creek and Mineral Creek. FLASH FLOOD...RADAR INDICATED FLASH FLOOD DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Flooding of washes and creeks will occur, some dirt roads will become muddy and impassable. Paved roads and underpasses could become flooded as well. In hilly or mountainous terrain, there are many low water crossings which will become dangerous in heavy rain. Do not attempt to cross flooded roads. Find an alternate route. Remain alert for flooding even in locations not receiving rain. Normally dry washes, slot canyons and creeks can become raging killer currents in a matter of minutes, even from distant rainfall.
